intro: Croton ruderalis, commonly known as the weed croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful foliage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Croton ruderalis is known for its adaptability and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
